definition: indiscriminately included in company (without any qualification)/see 濫竽充數|滥竽充数[lan4 yu2 chong1 shu4]
overflowing/excessive/indiscriminate
free reed wind instrument similar to the sheng 笙[sheng1], used in ancient China
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group

sentences.chinese: 他是个滥竽充数的演员。

sentences.english: You can also hear people saying it about themselves to show their modesty.
sentences.chinese: 人们有时也用“滥竽充数”来表示自谦。

sentences.english: He is a poor apology for an actor.
sentences.chinese: 他是个滥竽充数的演员。

sentences.english: Am I just making up numbers?
Are you just making up numbers?
He is a poor apology for a researcher of the American drama.
sentences.chinese: 他不过是一名滥竽充数的美国戏剧研究者。

definition: lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to carry out one's duties perfunctorily/to fulfill one's responsibility
fool/stupid person

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
lit. the scholar buys a donkey (idiom); fig. long-winded verbiage that never gets to the point/idiom mocking scholastic pomposity
neither fish nor fowl/resembling nothing on earth
crowing like a cock and stealing like a dog (idiom)/bag of tricks/useful talents
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
florid but insubstantial remarks/misleading way of saying sth
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
fool/dolt/clumsy oaf
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
a cut above/top quality
